title: Obituary: Jan Cheryl Fortner – WBIW
summary:
October 14, 1953 – April 15, 2020Jan Cheryl Fortner, 66, of Bedford, passed away Wednesday, April 15, 2020, at her residence after a long hard-fought battle with colorectal cancer.
She married Jerry Dean Fortner February 24, 1978.
Jan graduated from Mitchell High School in 1971 and enjoyed lunches with her high school friends.
She was extremely close to members of the Fortner family and continued the Worley Family tradition of quilting.
A family service will be Saturday, April 18, with Brother Jerry Allen officiating.

The moonrise happens just hours after the precise moment when the moon turns full - 2:21 p.m. - ensuring an extra special sight for skygazers looking for the elusive moon illusion.
The nickname wolf moon was given to January’s full moon because it is a month when wolves howl with hunger, according to the Farmer’s Almanac.
January’s full moon is also called the old moon, ice moon, snow moon and the moon after Yule.

title: More Than 100 Jacksonville FL Firefighters Tackle 3-Alarm Blaze
summary:

A massive, pre-dawn fire destroyed a four-story apartment building under construction on the Southside of Jacksonville — closing a portion of nearby Baymeadows Road and Interstate 295 for several hours Sunday.

title: Jacksonville's unemployment rate ends the year at a record low 2.6%
summary:

title: Jacksonville #4 ‘Most Popular City Moved To in 2019’
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. – Do you ever wonder why there are always new homes being built in Jacksonville?
According to a new 2020 Migration Report by Hire A Helper, Jacksonville had 55% more people moving in than moving out.
Whether in pursuit of warm weather or peaceful retirement, a vast number of Americans moved to Florida in 2019.
The top city to move to was Scottsdale, AZ, with twice (108%) as many people moving in versus out, followed by Durham, NC (71.7%) and Sarasota, FL (58%).
Other states attracting a large number of people were Texas (8%), North Carolina (7%), California (5.3%), and Georgia (5.1%).

title: 'No way' for November Duval Schools sales tax referendum, election supervisor says
summary:
Duval County Supervisor of Elections Mike Hogan said Monday that time has run out on being able to have a special election Nov. 5 on a half-cent sales tax referendum for schools.
Jacksonville City Council has repeatedly deferred taking a vote on setting a referendum date, and the next City Council meeting won't be until Aug. 13.
"Aug. 13 would be outside of the window for a November election," Hogan said.
Knowing that they [City Council] are not going to meet again until Aug. 13, I don't think there's any way."
A successful sales tax referendum this year would have enabled the school district to start collecting the tax on Jan. 1.

title: Florida’s invasive herpes monkeys can now be found from Jacksonville to Tampa
summary:
click to enlarge Photo via Adobe StockRhesus macaqueSilver Springs State Park has been home to a large troop of invasive, STD-carrying monkeys for almost a century, but now sightings are becoming more frequent in Florida cities hundreds of miles from the park.According to a new report from First Coast News , the population of rhesus macaques has expanded considerably over the years, and the monkeys are now being spotted in northeast cities like St. Johns, St. Augustine, Palatka, Welaka and Elkton, and as far south as Apopka and Tampa.The monkeys were originally part of a failed tourist attraction called Colonel Tooey's Jungle Cruise in the 1930s.A survey performed in 2018 found that the Silver Springs troop now consists of roughly 300 monkeys, and 25 percent of that population carries herpes B , which, while extremely rare in humans, can cause brain damage or even death if not treated immediately.The report states that efforts to control the rhesus macaques population ceased in 2012, but a feeding ban was put in place by the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission in 2017.
The FWC reported 23 incidents of human injuries between 1977 and 1984, but has not kept records since.In November 2019, a kayaker in Silver Springs State Park filmed dozens of monkeys diving from trees uncomfortably close to his boat.

title: Jacksonville metropolitan area unemployment rate falls to 2.8%
summary:
Jacksonville’s unemployment rate edged lower in October as job growth surged, the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity reported Friday.
The jobless rate in the Jacksonville metropolitan area (Duval, Baker, Clay, Nassau and St. Johns counties) fell from 2.9% in September to 2.8% in October.
UNF economist Albert Loh said the unemployment rate remaining below 3% indicates a strong labor market for Northeast Florida.
Jacksonville’s job growth beat Florida’s statewide growth rate of 2.6%.
Florida’s unemployment rate was unchanged at a seasonally-adjusted 3.2% in October, the Department of Economic Opportunity said.

The 55% decrease in net loss year-over-year is largely due to a $6.1 million decrease in operating expenses as a result of our restructuring of operations.

summary:
(CNN) Two young siblings who were missing in Jacksonville, Florida, have been found safe, city and law enforcement officials said.
Braxton Williams, 6, and his sister Bri'ya Williams, 5, were found Tuesday in a dense wooded area "about 400 meters" north of their home, Sheriff Mike Williams told reporters.
A member of a search and rescue team heard a child's voice, followed it and eventually found them, Williams said.
The sheriff said the children wandered off from their home and made it to a dilapidated pump house for shelter.
"They are lively and talkative, and asked for a cheese pizza," Williams said.

title: Remember? Snowstorm hits Jacksonville in December 1989
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. – The Christmas of 1989 was one to remember in Jacksonville with so much snow sticking to the ground people sledded down the Dames Point Bridge.
The historic event resulted when arctic air pushed temperatures below freezing through Florida with ice accumulating down to Miami.
Jacksonville Naval Air Station 1 inch of snow fell, while at Jacksonville Beach 2.5 inches was recorded.
By December 23, 1989, Counter-clockwise winds around the low pushed the arctic front south across Florida with cold temperatures surging southward across the entire peninsula.
By Christmas morning much of the snow began melting.

title: Murders and violent crime rose in Duval County in 2019, despite Jacksonville officials’ efforts
summary:
Duval County continues to have the highest murder rate in the state, and the problem is only getting worse, despite Jacksonville officials’ efforts.
Despite the outrage, despite the programming, despite the increased police funding, Duval County’s murder rate, already the state’s highest, continued to rise in the first six months of 2019.
The murder rate rose by about nine percent, and the violent crime rate rose by about six percent, even though the data didn’t include crime statistics from the Jacksonville Beach Police Department.
The only good news for Duval County is that the overall crime rate dropped by 10 percent, mostly due to a drop in thefts.
This comes as the state overall has seen an eight-percent drop in the murder rate, a two-percent drop in the violent crime rate and a six-percent drop in the overall crime rate.

title: Jacksonville #4 ‘Most Popular City Moved To in 2019’
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. – Do you ever wonder why there are always new homes being built in Jacksonville?
According to a new 2020 Migration Report by Hire A Helper, Jacksonville had 55% more people moving in than moving out.
Whether in pursuit of warm weather or peaceful retirement, a vast number of Americans moved to Florida in 2019.
The top city to move to was Scottsdale, AZ, with twice (108%) as many people moving in versus out, followed by Durham, NC (71.7%) and Sarasota, FL (58%).
Other states attracting a large number of people were Texas (8%), North Carolina (7%), California (5.3%), and Georgia (5.1%).

title: 4 Great White Sharks Tracked Off Florida East Coast
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Florida – Four Great White sharks weighing up to 1,200 pounds were recently tracked swimming off of Florida’s east coast.
Ironbound, a 12-foot, 4-inch adult male Great White shark that weighs 1,000 pounds, was also tracked off of Jacksonville Beach, Florida on December 4, 2019.
The great white shark (Carcharodon carcharias) population has been growing along the U.S. East Coast, according to a study by NOAA Fisheries.
The study also found that great white sharks occur primarily between Massachusetts and New Jersey during the summer, off Florida during winter, and with a broad distribution along the U.S. East Coast during spring and fall.
To stay up-to-date on the Florida Great White sharks’ latest locations, visit the Ocearch tracking map.

title: Jacksonville's unemployment rate ends the year at a record low 2.6%
summary:
Jacksonville’s unemployment rate held steady at a record low level in December, the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity reported Friday.
Florida’s unemployment rate fell by 0.1 percentage point to a seasonally adjusted 3% last month, the lowest statewide rate since comparable data was compiled beginning in 1976.
The University of North Florida's Local Economic Indicators Project reported when the data is seasonally adjusted, Jacksonville's unemployment rate rose from 2.61% in November to 2.87% last month.
Duval County’s unemployment rate fell by 0.1 point in December to 2.7% without seasonal adjustment, the Department of Economic Opportunity said.
Florida’s statewide growth rate for the year was 2.4%.

title: Florida teen dies after being hit by school bus near West Palm
summary:
A 15-year-old girl died Wednesday morning after being hit by a Palm Beach County School District bus just outside the West Palm Beach city limits, the Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office said.
Authorities did not identify the girl or the school she attended, though it did not appear she was getting on the school bus.
The crash happened at about 6:30 a.m. near the intersection of Haverhill and Elmhurst roads, a residential area south of Okeechobee Boulevard.
The sheriff’s office said the teenager was crossing the street as the bus turned.

title: 2019 home sales break record for Jacksonville area
summary:
Statistics from the Northeast Florida Association of Realtors show a historic year for home sales.
There were more homes sold on the First Coast in one year than ever before in 2019, according to a new report from the Northeast Florida Association of Realtors.
The 31,881 home sales were up by 5.4 percent over 2018 and the highest figure on record, the association said said.
The average price was $276,586, a 4 percent jump over 2018’s average of $266,055.
In the monthly comparison, December saw 2,561 homes sold on the First Coast, an 8.6 percent increase from a year ago for the same month.

title: 12-foot-long great white shark named ’Ironbound’ joins others off coast of Jacksonville
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. – Ironbound, a nearly 1,000-pound great white shark tracked by OCEARCH, has been hanging out off the coast of Jacksonville.
The male shark joins other large sharks such as Bailey, an 800-pound tiger shark, and Sydney, a 12-foot white shark.
Ironbound is named after West Ironbound Island near Lunenburg, Nova Scotia, Ocearch said.

summary:

title: JSO: Man found shot to death in car in broad daylight
summary:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. – A man was shot and killed Saturday afternoon inside a car in a neighborhood on the Northside, the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office said.
Police said they got a 911 call just before 5 p.m. that someone had been shot on High Plains Drive.
They found the man dead inside a vehicle.
Police said the man had been shot at least one time and that there were indications that multiple shots had been fired.
Police had no suspect description and asked anyone with information about the shooting to contact JSO at 630-0500 or CrimeStoppers at 1-866-845-TIPS.

title: Newton-John, Travolta coming to Jacksonville for 'Grease' sing-along
summary:
Grease is the word, or at least it will be in December when John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John visit Jacksonville for a sing-along version of their 1978 musical hit "Grease."
Travolta and Newton-John will be on hand for a screening of the film on Sunday, Dec. 15, at Daily's Place.
Travolta played carefree bad boy Danny Zuko and Newton-John was the innocent Sandy in the film, set at fictional Rydell High.
A portion of the proceeds will benefit the Olivia Newton-John Cancer Wellness & Research Centre.
“'Grease' holds such a special place in my heart that when John and I talked about this reunion I was excited,” Olivia Newton-John said in the release.

title: Case of 23-year-old found dead in Mandarin apartment classified as a murder
summary:

title: Mayport‘s newest warship welcomed by US Navy
summary:
Naval Station Mayport‘s newest littoral combat ship, the USS St. Louis, is now in the U.S. Navy’s hands, set to be officially commissioned this summer before moving to Northeast Florida.
The U.S. Navy‘s newest littoral combat ship is one step closer to its Naval Station Mayport dock after the future USS St. Louis was officially delivered by Lockheed Martin.
A littoral can make travel at nearly 50 mph and carry a Sikorsky H-60 military helicopter and missiles, the Navy said.
Eight will ultimately berth at the Navy's East Coast littoral combat ship base.
"With LCS 19’s delivery, the U.S. Navy has 10 Freedom-variant littoral combat ships in the fleet," Lockheed Martin executive Joe DePietro said.
